snippet: After legislators held a brief session, heeding a call by President Mohamed Morsi, the top court said that his order was illegal.
abstract: Egypt's Parliament, summoned by a decree from newly elected Pres Mohamed Morsi, meets for the first time since the nation's military rulers dissolved it; holds a single vote to appeal the court decision authorizing the shutdown; move draws criticism from the Constitutional Court and escalates a power struggle between the Islamist elected officials and top generals

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim, Mayy El Sheikh and Mai Ayyad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After legislators held a brief session, heeding a call by President Mohamed Morsi, the top court said that his order was illegal.

headline.seo: Egyptian Leaders Meet in Defiance of Court and Military
headline.main: Egyptian Leaders Meet in Defiance of Court and Military
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Parliament Meets in Defiance of Court and Military Orders
